results.title: 3 things
results.brief_description: This humourous very short experimental film has a twist to it - it has three everyday things that will make you take a second look. Fun, quirky, different.

results.title: Days of Echuca
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling and Barbara Day
results.brief_description: Barbara courageously and openly speaks of the hardships she has endured in her life and how she has managed to recover from the tragedies of her life because she draws support from her spirituality, her family and her community. This story was produced as part of a project called Voices from the Riverlands, in partnership with the Njernda Aboriginal Corporation.

results.title: Close to Slavery: Black Work in White History
results.brief_description: Comprehensively portrayed by the archival footage in this film is a harrowing history of a government policy forcing Aboriginal Australians to assimilate to the white definitions of education and work, mission stations, removal of Aboriginal children, forced labour often in deplorable conditions and exploitation.

results.title: Grandmother's butterfly
results.brief_description:
Phoung traces her family’s journey to Australia and her sadness of leaving behind her grandmother. This story was created as part of a project that marked the 30th anniversary of the first wave of migration from Vietnam to Australia and was funded by VicHealth.
Made at ACMI as part of the ‘Recovering Hope’ Digital Storytelling project, in partnership with VicHealth and Belgium Street Neighbourhood House.

results.title: The Goddess and the poet
results.creator_credit: David Meagher, Roberto Salvatore and ACMI
results.brief_description: Meet Christos Raskatos, old fashioned romantic. Meet him as a poet who has a love affair with words, as a local in love with Lorne and as a guy who catches a crayfish now and then in paradise. Interview taken at Lorne Fisheries, Lorne Pier.

results.title: The Bridge
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour and audio
results.brief_description:
“The Bridge” is a celebration of a childhood sense of place and belonging to the filmmakers’ birthplace, Warrandyte by video artist John Hipwell. Created to celebrate the artists’ early nexus with the neighbourhood, landscape and ambience of Warrandyte and its surrounds. “The Bridge” over the Yarra River also symbolises the journey from childhood to manhood. The Visaural (video painting with sound scape) is made up of 8 x 30 sec. short films each representing an important particular place central to the artists’ maturation. When played conitnuously and randomly “The Bridge” becomes a metaphor for the filmmakers’ early journey of adventure, discovery and development.
The titles are:
1. Home, Presbyterian Church and The Bridge
2. Gold mines, Petrol Station and The Bridge
3. Research Look Out, Monsalvat and The Bridge
4. Primary School, Folk Art and The Bridge
5. Creek, Yarra River and The Bridge
6. Moonlight Cottage, Potters Cottage and The Bridge
7. War Memorial, Car wrecks and The Bridge
8. Bush fire, North Warrandyte Fire Brigade and The Bridge
Music composed by John B. Hipwell (John Hipwell’s father)
and cinematography and editing by Adis Hondo.

results.title: Drink Deep
results.brief_description: Drink Deep is a lyrical vision of friendship, hidden secrets, and desires. Cohen uses several types of film image to add texture to the layered composition. Beautiful shades of grey, silver, black and blue echo the water, reminiscent of early photography and silverprints. Cohen says, “The piece was constructed primarily from footage I’d shot of skinnydippers at swimming holes in Georgia and rural Pennsylvania. It’s about water and memory and stories just submerged. It is also, in part, a response to thinking about censorship. I would say that Drink Deep is both unabashedly and deceptively romantic. Surface, flow, and undertow. What looks like paradise is always paradise lost.” Music composed by Stephen Vitiello and performed with Gabriel Cohen and Mary Wooten.
